chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Allen Miner

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:48 AM  Defendant Michael Allen Miner in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Michael Allen Miner.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls Officer Collin Deans-Brandt. Officer Deans-Brandt sworn and testified. State direct examination of Officer Deans-Brandt. Witness identifies defendant. Attorney Nelsen cross examination of Officer Deans-Brandt. State makes argument for bind over. Attorney Nelsen makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for arraignment in 22CF340. Court sets arraignment in 22CF340 and a status in 22CM260.
Arraignment scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:18 PM Defendant Michael Allen Miner in court.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Plans to go today and see about a public defender. Court questions why he has taken so long. Defendant indicates has no phone and has been living in a tent. 
Court indicates could waive time limits if state does not object. 
Defendant waives time limits. No objection by State.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

3:11 PM Defendant Michael Allen Miner appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Michael Allen Miner.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading and enters a plea(s) of not guilty. Court calls cases 22CM260 and 22CT122. In case 22CM260, the State requests $1000 signature bond. In 22CT122, the State requests $1500 signature bond.  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No contact with with SW (Victim in CM file). Court notes that there is a felony count in the CT case. State notes that the defendant does not have any criminal history. Attorney Hoffman asks for preliminary hearing on felony count. Case will be renumbered to CF file. 

Court orders signature bonds. In 22CM260, $1000 signature bond. No contact with SW. in 22CT122 (will be a CF file) No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
